Reviews.Title: “Great location, price and lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KATIEnSHAUN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights, the hotel was clean, staff were friendly, breakfast was great and it was great value for money. There was a metro stop 2 minutes walk from hotel and we travelled to all main tourist attractions on metro for only 4 euro a day (cost of day ticket). The hotel was also only 10-15 minute walk or one stop on metro from main train station (Termini Station) in Rome. We caught Leonardo express train from airport to this station then walked to hotel ...much cheaper than a taxi! Excellent hotel and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samantha D
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid for this hotel, I wasn't expecting too much! But I have to say it was a little gem and fantastic value for money. Just a 5 minute walk from Termini and a 2 minute walk from the nearest Metro, it is very conveniently located. It is housed on the 1st floor of an old building - the entrance hall and lift are a bit jaded, but don't be put off, because once you step into the Dolomiti's little lobby, you'll be very pleasantly surprised! Very compact, but spottlessly clean, nicely decorated and every member of staff we encountered during our stay could not have been more friendly or helpful. Our room was not a bad size at all for a 3 star city hotel, with a lovely little bathroom complete with walk in enclosed shower. Again, everything was spotlessly clean, I couldn't fault it! Of course you can hear traffic with the windows open, but once the windows were shut, it was almost completely sound proofed. there was air conditioning, although we didn't need it in March (best time of year to visit Rome by the way!). Again, we weren't expecting too much for breakfast, but wrong again! There was a wonderful selection of fresh pastries and croissants, as well as cereal, yoghurt and fruit, and although the coffee from the machine was pretty unpleasant, the staff offered to make a cappucino every morning and that was delicious! I really haven't got anything negative to say about this hotel at all and I would have no hesitation either recommending it or staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: Brendab72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderfully located. Our room was clean and not too small. We faced the street and it was absolutely quiet at night. The breakfast was adequate and the free internet usage was nice. It is very close to the Castro Pretorio station and fairly close to Termini, too. The elevator stops between floors so you must carry luggage for a few steps regardless of the floor you stay on. There was a great pizza place just down the street that we frequented several times. It's to the right near the end of the street. We didn't have any problems to speak of and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shiri r
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! The staff was really nice and helpfull, The room was clean and quiet. The location was perfect - 50 meters from the metro station and 5 minutes from the termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to station”
Reviews.Author: lorisz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June '11 and was surprised at how much better the area to the right of the train station (as you leave through the front) is than the left. Quieter, more business-like neighborhood with an adequate number of shops and restaurants. The hotel was clean, staff was nice, bathroom fairly large for Rome, A/C worked great, window opened onto busy side street but with double-shutters it was absolutely silent at night. I usually stay in charming, more personal B&B's so I'm not used to the coldness of a large hotel, but this one was fine, if a bit pricey for the value. But I went during the peak season. Breakfast was just ok, unless you like Costco-type croissants and forgettable coffee & espresso, but I never base my stay on the breakfast quality. The hotel is very close to a metro station or if you want to walk about 10 minutes you can go to Termini Station--really easy!! All staff spoke English. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Two night in roma”
Reviews.Author: jamiegill
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value for money. Safe and clean and v close to termini station. Small rooms but overall a good home base for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation,helpful reception”
Reviews.Author: tatranka_2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in hotel Dolomiti, close to metro station Castro Pretorio or Termini, easy to find. We had quiet, clean room with aircon. The daily receptionist were fluent in English and always very helpful & professional. They helped us to organize two trips for us. Breakfast was poor...

Reviews.Title: “It is an OK hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: BOPOHA
Reviews.Content: It is an OK hotel for the money. It is small and shares the building with a couple of other hotels. I was traveling by myself and did not like the neighborhood too much but I had to stay close to the Stazione Termini so I could get an early morning train back to the airport. It is however close to the Metro station so when getting back from the city to the hotel at night it was a very short walk. Same thing happened to me as to other reviewer: the breakfast staff ignored me but the locals were offered fresh espresso/cappuccino immediately upon entering the dining room. I did not know that there was an option to get the espresso (which I prefer over the “American” coffee) so I was a little disappointed that I was not offered it. The lady who checked me in was polite but not super helpful or nice. She did not mentioned the internet or the fact that you can get a “to go” breakfast if you have to check out early in the morning (it was in the note I found in the room, but I only found out about it on the day when I was checking out). However the older gentlemen who was on desk duty at night was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and practical”
Reviews.Author: filber70
Reviews.Content: A good choice if you are traveling with young children. Clean and tidy. Located conveniently near public transport. Nice breakfast. Our youngest shed a tear when we left as she said she would miss the lovely breakfast ladies.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: janedian000
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was excellent. Very close to both the metro and a large train station. The rooms were very clean, quiet and comfortable. Nothing overly luxurious but definitely nice for the price. The staff at the front desk were friendly as were the cleaning staff. We were very pleased with our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did NOT refund money due to volcanic ash”
Reviews.Author: tamaramich
Reviews.Content: I am extremely disappointed in this Hotel. I have not stayed here however i was supposed to. We had to reschedule our trip due to the volcanic ash for later in the month. The hotel would not refund our money or even credit the amount toward a future stay. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room - So So Staff”
Reviews.Author: creamcitym
Reviews.Content: I'm an older solo male traveler who initially found the Hotel Dolomiti as a fair value given it's location and last minute availability in Rome. Pretty much mid-range and appreciate locations close to the rail station which the Dolomiti is. When I first arrived I went to the ground floor lobby only to be told that the Dolomiti lobby is one floor up of which I carried my bag. There is an elevator but stops a 1/2 flight above the floor you select so there is some bag carrying and stair climbing involved. As others have stated, it's not close to Rome attractions so you will need to be prepared to fill some transportation needs on your own. It is close to the hop-on hop-off city bus tour which boards next to the train station which is a plus for as long as you want to use it. I found the daytime staff lady to be nicest and helpful as well as the younger gentleman but not necessarily all others. Especially the breakfast lady seemed bossy laying out a whole list of rules to follow for breakfast - where to sit and how to serve yourself etc. I just walked out twice until the third time she just welcomed me and left me alone. On my last day she told me they were full and I again left not wanting to deal with her for a simple bite to eat. No complaints of the room itself which was clean and reasonably sized and had AC. Wi-Fi was charged to my room at a rate of 6E/3hrs 10E/6hrs ... Next time I would pay more for a room between the attractions (ruins and Vatican) shorten the stay and eliminate all the walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: labakk
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very convenient. We could walk to the main train station or a smaller stop close by. The room was adequate, clean and tidy. Breakfast was included which was a smorgasbord. On more than one morning we were completely ignored by the breakfast staff, while locals were offerred fresh coffee/cuppacino immediately upon entering the room. On every occassion we (as westerners) had to ask for our coffee. We also found one staff member on the desk to be very rude. Free internet for 10 mins on hotel computer was handy. Lift doesn't go to every floor, so be prepared to carry your bags. Entry to hotel under renovation while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station, decent rooms, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ladybug09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends in our late 20s. I was in a triple room - kind of small, but 2 large windows and comfortable enough. The bathroom was very small, but clean. We booked at Dolomiti, but our rooms were in Hotel Lacheas (or something like that) - apparently it is owned by the same people. Some of my friends were in Hotel Dolomiti, so I saw their rooms, and our front desk and breakfast was in Hotel Dolomiti. Breakfast was ok - there was a woman who made me coffee, but only on the last day of my 3 night stay. Not a huge selection.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for the price”
Reviews.Author: redwoody128
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the Termini Train Station within easy walking distance. Staff was very friendly and spoke English well. I had emailed the hotel prior to our visit to arrange for us to drop off our luggage so we go sightseeing (we arrived in Rome at 9:00 am). They said it was no problem and they had a secure area to store it. It turned out our room was ready and we just put our luggage there. We told the checkin person that we where leaving early and he asked if we would like a sack breakfast to take with us. It was in our fridge when we got back that evening (Juice, roll, croissant and jam; a good sack breakfast ). Hotel is small, it shares the building with one or two other hotels. The room is small but clean and comfortable. Room is quiet. Not a luxury hotel obviously, but I found it to be a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bristraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located - close to the Termini (walking distance). We walked from the termini after catching a bus from the airport. We were able to check-in early, which was good. The hotel is located within a building with a couple of other hotels, but easy to find. Our room was located one the 3rd or 4th level on the road side, but the double glazing was perfect and we barely heard any noise - so we're not sure as to why the other reviews complained of this. The bathroom wasn't the greatest but it was clean enough for what we needed it for. We ate the included breakfast a couple of mornings, which consisted of crossaints, cereal, coffee (made from a commercial coffee machine), juice and fruit. The hotel owners seemed a bit offended one of the mornings when we wanted to get an early start on the Vatican and didn't have breakfast there. Like many hotels in Europe we had to leave our key with reception but this was never a problem. There is an internet cafe across the road, which we regularly used, as well as a convenience supermarket across the road. We also regularly ate at some of the nearby restaurants. All in all, the hotel was well located with lots of facilities nearby and was clean. The staff were always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but heating off in mid.winter”
Reviews.Author: PO_Traveller
Reviews.Content: It’s been a while, since we stay – 4 nights over New Year’s. We booked last minute and thought that we had found a bargain. The hotel is indeed fairly affordable and conveniently located to the central station – albeit not in a particularly salubrious part of town. Our room faced the road and was rather noisy, with round-the-clock traffic along the main throughfare just outside. Walls were also so thin that you could literally hear the guests on the other breath and sneeze and … The biggest problem was heating – or lack thereof. The rooms were always freezing cold, heating off – although management insisted otherwise. Fortunately, we did not spend much time in the room other than to sleep and wash, but boy, it was cold! On the upside: rooms were perfectly clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was the usual sad Italian affair, but we’ve had worse. In light of the price and the convenient location, overall not too bad., but the heating issue was a real problem.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Dr-Preet
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a week in July. We decided on this hotel after A LOT of searching and I am very glad we chose it. It is a lovely hotel, with helpful english speaking staff and a great location. It is a 10 minute walk of Termini, 1 minute was to the metro station Castro Pretorio and about 15 minute walk to Republica where there are some tourist . Our room was very spacious and everything was very well looked after and clean. Rooms were serviced everyday. The breakfast is the standard continental breakfast of pastries, cereal, ham, chesse, bread rolls, youghurts and fruit. Which was all fresh and fine, because we weren't expecting anything more. There is also a supermarket across the road which came in very handy, we bought bottles of water from here and just stored them in the fridge in our room, to take out with this us each day...which definitely works out cheaper than buying water whilst you are out an about! As for dinner, there are a few restaurants in the surrounding area. We were very happy with our stay, it was very easy to get to all the tourist attractions and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Friend007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in June. This hotel is quite close to the Roma termini station..about 5 minutes walk. We had a pleasant stay here..the rooms were just about the right size..not too big or too small. The best part was the airconditioning with remote control..i would say AC is must in Rome in summer. Breakfast was just average .. but it didnt bother us much. Overall nice experience and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: goggin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean, but it wasn't anything special. It seems hard to find a good hotel for a good price in Rome, and this worked well for us. It was nice to be so close to Termini for arriving and departing from Rome, but the hotel's close location to the metro stop is not really as big of a bonus as it appeared at first. The metro system in Rome is not great -- we really just took it to the Colosseum and back from the Spanish Steps. It doesn't go to a lot of the other main tourist spots in Rome, so the metro was not very useful. The hotel had air-conditioning, which was a definite must in June, as Rome was blistering hot. There's not really an outstanding feature of this hotel, but it was nice, clean, and worked. If you can afford it, get closer to the city though, so you'll spend less time walking than we did!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mamiem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dolomiti one night because of its location near the train station, as we had to catch a 10 am flight back home the next day. The hotel is four easy blocks from Termini and the location was perfect for us. The room was very nice and very clean, all recently renovated with a large bathroom and a very good shower. There was also a small bar fridge, which was very convenient. We were very grateful for the air conditioner, as it was very hot in Rome at the end of May. Staff was very helpful, and they packed a breakfast for us to take along. There are many good restaurants and pizzerias right around - we ate a wonderful pizza at a little restaurant nearby, I wish I could remember the name. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the main railway station Termini”
Reviews.Author: gajm
Reviews.Content: We were a family with teenage children staying too nights at this great hotel. It is very near to the main railway station Termini, ten minutes walk and the metro station is 100 meters from the entrance. We paid €316,00 in four for two nights in one room. We room was clean, quiet and big enough. The television had also some channels in English. The bathroom was big and clean. There is some traffic in the street bus as soon as you close the window you don't hear anything. Also you heard hardly anything from the other rooms or the corridor. Breakfast is a buffet with good "cappuccino" or American coffee, tea, juice, brioches, yogurt, cereals that you can have as much as you want. There is also some bread and jam. You can use internet to check your e-mail or the latest events in the city without extra payment. They also keep your luggage without charge if you have the train leaving late. The area is very good, you can easily reach the restaurants by foot without problems also in the evening. The personnel is very polite and helpful; you get advice and suggestions for any question you may have. I recommend this hotel for anyone and specially for those moving with the public means (train, metro).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ginger_charlie
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised by this hotel. It was immaculately clean, and the rooms albeit small, were very comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was simple (pastries, bread rolls, cereal, yoghurts and fruit) but tasty and more than adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only complaints were could make were that the shower wasn't great, and there was no air conditioning, which even in March which could have done with. Location was fab for the price, far better than we expected - 10min walk from Termini station and 1min from a metro stop. We found the walk into central Rome took about 25mins. All in all, it was great for us - a young couple on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: christine94
Reviews.Content: Excellent family run hotel. Near Termini station and bus stop from airport. Bank with A.T.M machine across road. Also supermarket and pharmacy. Rooms are clean and warm. Staff are helpful. Breakfast good continental. Packed us a breakfast to take to the airport. We would stay here again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LindyluCalifornia
Reviews.Content: 4 blocks from the Termini, clean, quiet, comfortable room, good Italian breakfast served in a nice size dining room, accommodating staff. The lift stops at a landing that is inbetween the floors. So, example, our room was on the 4th floor, you either exit on the 4th floor and walk down 12 steps or you exit on the 3rd floor and walk up 12 steps. Strange. I would probably stay there again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kakishita
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nicely updated and have a mini bar. The mini bar has inexpensive drinks, about what you'd pay for in a mini market. Breakfast had a ton of pastries, cereal, meat and cheeses. Hot water didn't run out. Be sure to bring your own loofah or face towel if you need one. For towels, only bath and hand towels are supplied. Internet is fast there to use and they charge 4.50 Euros to use for an hour, but first 10 minutes are free. Also has a printer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolLiverbird
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pleasant to stay in, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast is good,have a nice breakfast room, we had a early return and they even supplied us with some breakfast to take with us to the airport, well looked after!! Conveniently located close to metro and bus station allows to go anywhere in Rome. Staff friendly, ready to help. Would return again and highly recommend it to everyone, Wonderful*****.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Siv1959
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pleasant to stay in. Conveniently located close to metro and bus station allows to go anywhere in Rome. Staff friendly, ready to help. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ceolistic
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel based on reviews on this site. The hotel is located in a building with a 2 other hotels, it is on the first floor. The lift is small but you shouldnt need to use it. It is very easy to find with Hotel Dolomiti Clearly marked on the outside. We had a triple room with three single beds, it was clean, air-conditioned, Sky News and CNN, sound proofed from traffic and bathroom with all mod cons. I had free wireless internet on my laptop which was important to me. The breakfast in the morning was a good experience - cereal, juice, bread, ham, cheese and pastries. It was not spectacular breakfast and I would prefer if the milk was colder but we werent there for the food. The staff welcomed us with a smile at all times, and the receptionist's spoke good english and gave us lots of advice on what to do in the city. Bear in mind this is a 3 star hotel, and you get what you expect for a 3 star hotel - and this is probably one of the better three star hotels you will find. It you want luxury dont stay in this district. However, what really made this hotel stay so good for me was the LOCATION. It is 30 seconds from the Castro Pretoria metro stop, and only 5-7mins walk from Termini Train Station. On the Metro line you can get to all the main tourist sites. It is surrounded by lots of low-cost restaurants serving excellent food, there is a supermarket across the road. We felt very safe at all times as the hotel is far enough away from Termini. There is a government building across the road and there were always armed police around so that re-inforced my sense of security. I highly recommend Dolomiti Hotel on your visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “very clean-even by my standards!”
Reviews.Author: lucylu18
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for a short break with my mum, we wanted something cheap but were weary as we heard the hotels in Rome were not as cleany as hotels in england. Quite easy to find and in an excellent location near the Termini. When we got there the receptionist was lovely and helpful, even telling us where to go in Rome, the rooms were newly refurbished and were so clean i couldnt fault them. This is saying something as i am really fussy about quality of rooms abroad, but even the bathroom was great, i was very surprised. Breakfast was also lovely, i wasnt expecting anything amazing once again but it filled a gap until lunch time. Would definately go there again as it was cheap, in a great location and clean. The only fault about it was on the first night we could not sleep due to a group of italians shouting at the top of their voices until about 4, until i got up and shouted some english at them- they obviously understood it cos it didn't happen again! hope you enjoy it there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideNev
Reviews.Content: Location is great, close to the Railway Station & rooms are quiet. Management was very friendly & easy going. Spoke good english & nothing was too much trouble. Rooms well appointed. Would deffinitly stay there again. Very well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Bad area of town, but very clean...”
Reviews.Author: I_Adore_Italy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Dolomiti. From the outside, it does not look nice at all. It is in a building with other hotels, and the area is not the best. Once you walk inside, however, things begin to look up. The building itself is actually very nice. Service at the front desk is suffucient...not overly friendly or helpful, but good enough. The rooms we had were exceptionally clean and the AC worked well. You have to leave your room key plugged into an outlet by the door in order for the AC and lights to work. The bathroom was very nice and clean (although our towels did have a strange smell to them). Breakfast was just okay. Nothing special at all. Croissants, processed cheese, bad-looking ham, room-temperature milk. Cappucinos were alright...you have to ask for them. Overall, not a bad experience....though next time I will stay in a nicer part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable And Clean But beware of being cheated on the Price”
Reviews.Author: Pravasini
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is most ideally situated for tourists in Rome.Very close to the Station- ROMA TERMINI , even my 4 year old daughter could walk with her stroller.The hotel exterior is non existant but the rooms are good in size and very clean. There is running hot water day and nite and good quality linen is provided.Breakfast was OK but the coffee was very good. The only draw back in out stay was that we extended our stay in this hotel to further 3 days and got a price quaoted to us from their website.This was a good 60€ less than what we had paid for the earlier stay.But when it was time to pay the final bill the price was hiked up.We did not have any written proof and the hotel manager took advantage of this.We felt cheated and for this reason alone i will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Italy”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTravelgirls
Reviews.Content: As a mom and two daughters (teenagers) we stayed here for one full week. We would do so again tomorrow, the family that ran the hotel were very proffessional and helpful, we felt very welcomed. Dolomiti Hotel is very, very clean which was important to us, our room was a little small but we expect that in Europe, and we spent little time in our room, we slept with the window open each night. The accomadations looked brand new, we had a non-smoking room. Breakfast was continental, croisants, pastries, cappucino/caffe lattes, yogurt and fresh fruit any time. Internet access available, very conveinent to metro, out the door to the right about 50 steps, we then went to Termini and switched to the A line. Termini is also close but area is a bit rough at night, men hanging out so we chose the station to the right exiting the hotel. We felt very safe walking in the area around our hotel in the evenings, restaraunts, laundry, grocer. The management was wonderful and always there to greet you with a smile and some kind words. Most everyone spoke enough English to get by. We were close enough to everything to come back to our room freshen up and go right back out. I did read the reviews before I chose this hotel, one talked about the stairs but there was an elvator, small but fine. Also someone wrote about the way the hotel is set up, there are different hotels in the same building but not an issue at all, just walk or ride to your floor, states clearly Dolomiti and someone is always there to greet you, non-issue. Feel comfortable choosing this hotel, you will love it, outside having work done on it, no effect on us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sile4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really excellent in every way. From the first moment we set foot in this hotel we got a very good feeling about it. The receptionist Mario was so welcoming. The security was top class. Breakfast lovely served with a smile The bedroom was very comfortable. The decor lovely. We looked forward to returning there after long tiring days sightseeing. On our last morning we had an early start to catch train and hotel provided a packed breakfest without having to be asked. We were also offered a capuchino before we left. All in all this hotel is to be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: trishaoh
Reviews.Content: Hi, This hotel is clean and nice. The rooms are small but exactly what you want. Location wise its good not far from the train station and there is about 4 or 5 really nice restaurants beside the hotel that are reasonably priced and food lovely. So all in all good choice of a hotel to stay in. The room cost is resonable also.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean, Safe, and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: Rivergallery
Reviews.Content: After getting the run around with a couple other hotels and B&B's I desided to go with my traveling partener's first choice. This hotel is used extensively by the American Navy based on La Maddelena (small island off the coast of Sardinia), for those going to Rome. The previous review is right on, very clean, staff very helpful and nice. I spoke no Italian, but got by just fine. One receptionist knows English very very well, and gave us specific and detailed instructions to the airport. Our cost was 85 Euro/night, we shared the cost. We got 2 twin beds, with the shared bath. I never once had to wait for the bathroom, there were two near our room. The shower doesn't come out full force, and the bidet is only cold water. That is the only negative I can think off. Again everything is super clean, YES especially the bathroom. This is a non-smoking hotel, but I did smell smoke a few times while in the hallway. Their website shows everything accurately. Just do be aware again of the stairs, you do have to climb stairs to get to the desk. The elevator stops either one level above or below the room levels. So you always have 2 flights to walk. They do have a cash discount. Like other hotels, air conditioner units are rolled in (need to be requested). The pillows are nice a fluffy acted like down, but not sure. I am allergic to down, but wasn't allergic at all to it. Their windows have two layers for sound proofing. Also like most european hotels, bedding is done after each customer moves, weekly, or on request. Towels are provided, as are bar soaps. There is also an in room safe, attached to the inside of the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: DavidGr
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel that shares the building with other hotels. It was difficult for us to find. The map on the website isn't very clear, and it doesn't help much when you're not sure where you're at to start with. If you take the train to the Termini station, when you get off the train, keep walking in the same direction that the train was going until you reach the front of the station. Walk down the street that is in front of the station to the right and the hotel "entrance" is on the right, tucked in off the street, about 6 blocks from Termini. There is a metro station only 2 blocks from the hotel. Once we found it, we got to our room and settled in. 4 single beds in a decent sized room with tile floor. The air conditioner was barely able to keep the room cool enough with 4 people in it, and it was warm outside so opening the window didn't help any. A small armoire with a few hangers, but not enough for 4 people, so we kept most of our clothes in the suitcases. Bathroom was okay, but shower stall was very small. Plenty of pastries, juice and coffee for breakfast...if you got there early enough (before 9). We slept in one day and by the time we got the breakfast area, there wasn't much left.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Good if You Have Early Morning Departure”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Chick5
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Italy, and stayed at the Dolomiti for my last night in Rome. I paid 99 Euros per night for a single, which was relatively inexpensive (I paid 130 Euros per night for the other hotel I stayed at). Room: My room was comfortable, clean, and spacious for a single. The bathroom was roomy as well. The bed was small, but comfortable enough. The room had a refrigerator stocked full of soda and alcohol (costly, though, so I didn't partake). I was quite happy with the room overall. Breakfast: The hotel had a decent breakfast (coffee, yogurt, and croissants). There was a computer near the breakfast room for internet access. Front Desk: The front desk staff was helpful and friendly, and I enjoyed talking with them. They spoke mostly Italian - only limited English. I was very happy about this, however, because I wanted the chance to try out my Italian! Food: I went to a wonderful restaurant around the corner and had the best dinner of my entire stay (exit hotel and walk left, then take a left at the first street. You'll see people sitting outside.) There's also a supermarket about 3 blocks away. Location: I chose this hotel because it was close enough to Termini to be convenient for an early morning departure, but far enough away from Termini to be safe and in a decent neighborhood. Because it was to the right of Termini, it was a bit further away from the sites and museums than the other hotels I stayed at (which is probably why it cost less). If you don't mind walking a bit more, then this is a great place to stay. Note: Yes, this hotel was safe, and during the day I felt totally fine walking around. However, I didn't feel as comfortable going out in the evening in this area as a single woman alone (compared to other areas that I stayed in in Rome), as it seemed a bit empty in some stretches. As you get closer to Termini it gets increasingly sketchy. Walking to dinner around the corner was fine, as it was about 8:30pm and only a block or two away. But I wouldn't have walked much further alone. If I had been in a group, however, I would have felt perfectly fine at night. Guests: There seemed to be a lot of hotel guests in their 20's here, so this would be a good place if you're in that age range and don't mind walking a bit further during the day to the sites. I would stay here again. Good place.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: mccookie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a short walk to the train station and there is a supermarket across the street. The double room was very small, with two twin beds and a desk, but not much room for anything else. The bathroom was even smaller and I found it very hard to move about comfortably (a stand up shower, bidet, toilet and sink all crammed into a space the size of a closet - eek!). The room was generally clean, though the sheets were not changed daily (this may be usual for Europe, as other hotels had the same practice). Breakfast is included (rolls, baked goods, coffee, juice and yogurt), though on the third morning, every table but ours had fresh rolls delivered to them. We thought that the girl at the breakfast service was very rude on account of this. On returning to Rome after a trip to the South, we were able to find a much nicer hotel just around the corner (see Best Western...go figure).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Ali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Dolomiti for 5 nights. It was 5-6 minutes walk from the Termini (main bus / train station), where our shuttle bus dropped us from the airport. We were allowed to check in at around 1am. All the staff were very friendly and all spoke good English. Our room was spotless and was decorated nicely. Nice ensuite with bath/shower, only problem was slightly wonkey shower head. It was Double delux room with air con - if you stay here in summer you definitely need a room with air con, it's far to hot without. There was plently to eat for breakfast - very nice assortment of pastries (plain croissant, filled with Jam / chocolate / custard) and they were fresh every day. Also 2 types of cereal, assortment of preserves, cheese, fresh bread rolls, orange juice, coffee or cappucino, tea and assortment of yoghurts. The hotel reception is on the 1st floor of a 5 storey building. the surrounding area is OK - we felt quite safe even late at night - in fact there is some kind of diplomatic building across from the hotel and there are 2 the local police men in a van outside it 24/7 - so its unlikely that you will get mugged near by - all the police have huge guns! We recommend using the subway to get around rome - its really cheap, safe and much kinder to your feet, even the the nuns travel on the subway. There are automated machines to get tickets (which are valid for travel on bus or subway) when you go down. The buses are OK but can get really crowded and hot and very bumpy when travelling along the Roman cobbles. Be careful about getting a taxi when arriving from airport, we met lots of people who had got ripped off. We walked, but if you taxi make sure you agree a price before you set off (should be less than 15 euros from termini to hotel with cases). The Dolomiti was well worth staying at. We paid 595 euros for the 5 nights inc. breakfast and that was the most expensive room. We booked directly with the hotel website http://www.hotel-dolomiti.it The Vatican museum is really worth the trip - but you need to get there early around 8am to avoid massive cues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain, Great Location, Reasonable Prices”
Reviews.Author: writeratheart
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband and his 20-something aged brother and sister all shared a "family room" at the Dolomiti in late March 2006. My only complaint was that even with a courtyard room, the mornings were a little noisy --but then, Rome is noisy. Breakfast is simple and wonderful. Brief Internet access is readily available in the breakfast area, just long enough to send a few emails before heading out for the day. They held our bags for us all day after we had checked out so that we could catch a Red Eye back to London. A little bare in the room, but a huge bathroom and WELL worth the price and the location! We took a direct shuttle from the airport to the termini and walked to the hotel in less than 15 minutes. There's a quaint little Italian restaurant a few doors down -- it was good food, but the service was not-so-much. (My husband swears the waiter dropped the parm on the floor and proceeded to scoop it onto our plates seconds later). Needless to say, I would skip it next time. The best part of Hotel Dolomiti is that I booked the room on Venere.com (got an online coupon for 10 percent off) and between the four of us for two nights, we paid less than 320 Euros -- that works out to 80 euros a piece (or 40 euros/person/night). The best bargain of our entire European vacation!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Dolomiti
HotelInfo.Address: Via S. Martino della Battaglia, 11, 00185 Rome, Italy
